solution.p: Is the variance for the amount of money, in dollars, that shoppers spend on Saturdays at the mall the same as the variance for the amount of money that shoppers spend on Sundays at the mall? On Saturday, the average and the standard deviation of the data are respectively 80.26 dollars and 18.739 dollars. On Sunday, the average and the standard deviation of the data are respectively 84.38 dollars and 19.424 dollars. Use a 5 significance level to test the claim that the standard deviation for the amount of money that shoppers spend on Saturday is the same as the standard deviation for the amount of money that shoppers spend on Sunday. If normality plots are not provided assume that the samples are from normal populations.

Procedure: In the question, look for the keywords such as mean/average, proportion/percentage, variance/standard deviation! In this case, we have "standard deviation for the amount of money that shoppers spend" and two populations, thus we are going to perform Two Variances F Hypothesis Test.
Assumptions (select everything that applies): For Two Variances F Hypothesis Test,

ul.li: the samples must be simple random and independent, and
for each sample, the population must be normal;
the assumption "population standard deviations are unknown" is not necessary, but since it is technically satisfied we must select it as well.
